Description: Transamerica Financial Advisors agreed to provide refunds to clients and pay a penalty to settle allegations that it overcharged clients by improperly calculating advisory fees.

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
NAICS Translation: 52411: Direct Life, Health, and Medical Insurance Carriers
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Company: AEGON USA Investment Management LLC et al.
Description: The Securities and Exchange Commission announced charges against four Transamerica entities for misconduct involving faulty investment models and ordered the entities to refund $97 million to misled retail investors.

Private Litigation Case Title: Lequita Dennard v. Transamerica Corporation, et al

Description: Transamerica agreed to pay $1.33 million to settle allegations it marketed unauthorized health insurance products in Massachusetts and failed to cover mandated benefits.
Transamerica agreed to pay $11.2 million to settle multistate litigation regarding its use of the Social Security Administration's Death Master File.
Info Source: Department of Insurance Announces a Multi-Million Dollar Settlement with Transamerica, Targeted News Service, September 9, 2013 (via Nexis).

Description: World Group Securities agreed to pay $828,501 in restitution and a $50,000 administrative penalty ($25,000 if paid promptly) in settlement of allegations it failed to supervise its registered securities salesmen, allowing fraudulent acts to be carried out by salesmen under its supervisory control.

Agency: Arizona Department of Insurance and Financial Institutions
Notes: This case was brought by the Arizona Department of Insurance before it merged with the Department of Financial Institutions.

Description: Market Conduct Examination

Company: Life Investors Insurance Company of America
Life Investors Insurance Company of America
Transamerica Life Insurance Co. et al.
Transamerica Life Insurance Co. et al.
Description: Transamerica Life Insurance Co., Transamerica Advisors Life Insurance Co., Transamerica Advisors Life Insurance Co. of New York, Transamerica Financial Life Insurance Co., Monumental Life Insurance Co., Stonebridge Life Insurance Co., and Western Reserve Life Assurance Co. of Ohio agreed to pay $2.5 million to the state as part of a settlement of allegations they had inadequate procedures to ensure policies and other funds were timely investigated and paid out to beneficiaries.

Company: Transamerica Life Insurance Co. and Transamerica Premier Life Insurance Co.
Description: Transamerica Life Insurance Co. and Transamerica Premier Life Insurance Co. agreed to pay a $100,000 civil penalty in settlement of allegations that in some instances they failed to notify clients of all available benefits during a claim, did not make a decision on claims within 30 days, and did not issue payment within the legally required time among other offences.

Notes: Copy of Order not on Department website, details of shared or suspended penalties not available.

Description: Respondents issued group accident and sickness coverage pursuant to a non-compliant plan, using non-compliant forms and which terms of coverage failed to comply with NJ law; utilized a Preferred Provider network that was not certified or licensed as an ODS; provided certain coverages that included network and out-of-network benefits, but failed to seek or obtain Department approval of a selective contracting arrangement.  Respondents corrected deficiencies, and remediated all claims-related issues, including paying interest as applicable.
Agency: New Jersey Department of Banking & Insurance
New Jersey Department of Banking & Insurance

Description: Respondent issued noncompliant individual health benefit plans to New Jersey residents.
Agency: New Jersey Department of Banking & Insurance

Description: Four insurers agreed to pay a total of $2.2 million in restitution to 3,475 New York seniors from across the state for overcharging them on Medicare supplemental insurance policies in violation of New York law.
Agency: New York Department of Financial Services

Description: Transamerica paid restitution of $582,436 to New York policyholders and paid a civil penalty of $762,700 for insurance violations relating to disclosure and other practices.
Agency: New York Department of Financial Services

Company: LIFE INVESTORS INSURANCE COMPANY OF AMERICA

Description: Fine levied for issuing, delivering and using a policy form in Washington which had been disapproved by the Insurance Commissioner; Using disapproved Rates. RCW 48.18.100(1); RCW 48.19.040
Agency: Washington State Office of the Insurance Commissioner

Description: Fine levied for using a policy form that deviated from the form that had been filed and approved by the Commissioner; Accepting insurance business from unlicensed person, violating RCW 48.05.140. RCW 48.05.140; RCW 48.05.185; RCW 48.17.060; RCW 48.98.025
Agency: Washington State Office of the Insurance Commissioner

Description: Fine levied for incorrectly stating in its descriptions of coverage the timeframe within which an accidental death or accident loss must be reported under the policies. RCW 48.30.090
Agency: Washington State Office of the Insurance Commissioner

Description: Company fined for improperly denying coverage to ten Washington consumers who sought Medicare supplement coverage. RCW 48.66.045(1)(a); WAC 284-66-064(4)(a).
Agency: Washington State Office of the Insurance Commissioner

Description: $15,000 fine for issuing unauthorized certificates of coverage under association plans to Washington consumers, using unfiled rates and unfiled forms, using producers that were not properly licensed or appointed. The Company violated RCW 48.18.100(1); RCW 48.19.010(2); WAC 284-30-600(3)(b)
Agency: Washington State Office of the Insurance Commissioner

Description: In a multistate settlerment, Monumental Life Insurance Co. agreed to pay $37 million in additional death benefits for policies that were issued with rates based on race.
Info Source: MONUMENTAL LIFE TO PAY $37 MILLION IN DEATH BENEFITS OVER RACE-BASED PREMIUMS, Bestwire, June 13, 2003 (via Nexis).

Description: Transamerica agreed to make a $3 million administrative payment to a group of states as part of the resolution of issues raised during an examination of its market conduct relating to travel insurance.

FINRA announced that Transamerica Financial Advisors, Inc. agreed to pay approximately $4.4 million in restitution to approximately 2,400 customers for failing to supervise its registered representatives' recommendations of three different products - variable annuities, mutual funds, and 529 plans. FINRA also fined TFA $4.4 million.
Notes: FINRA is a securities industry self-regulatory body authorized by the federal government.

Description: NASD censured and fined 29 securities firms over $9.2 million for more than 8,000 late disclosures of reportable information about their brokers, including customer complaints, regulatory actions, and criminal charges and convictions.
Info Source: NASD Fines 29 Firms over $9.2 Million for Late Reporting, PR Newswire, November 30, 2004 (via Nexis).
Notes: FINRA is a securities industry self-regulatory body authorized by the federal government. This case was handled by its predecessor, the National Association of Securities Dealers (NASD).

Agency: New York Department of Financial Services
Washington State Office of the Insurance Commissioner

Description: Transamerica agreed to pay $5.4 million to settle an ERISA class action alleging that the company filled its 401(k) plan with underperforming proprietary investments.
Private Litigation Case Title: Karg et al v. Transamerica Corporation et al

Description: air pollution
Agency: South Coast (CA) Air Quality Management District
